neighbors.name: Harbin Farm Enterprises Llc
neighbors.claims: Harbin Farm Enterprises LLC is a Kansas entity managed by Dr. Gary Harbin, a prominent local orthopedic surgeon [Salina Ortho](https://www.salinaortho.com/harbin.html). Unlike a passive holding company, this entity is actively engaged in industrial land use; in 2023-2024, it filed applications to allow American Sand and Gravel, LLC to extend mining operations onto 175 acres of its property [Saline County Planning](https://salina-tv.com/cablecastapi/shows/25950/publicfiles/4). The entity also holds water rights for irrigation and industrial use (sand and gravel) [Kansas Dept of Agriculture](https://sftp.kda.ks.gov:4443/Notices/Stockton_Field_Office/2024/49991.20240409.Apv.Chg.pdf). Dr. Harbin is a documented donor to The Land Institute, a sustainable agriculture research organization, suggesting an interest in land conservation or perennial agriculture alongside industrial leasing [The Land Institute](https://landinstitute.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/09/Land-Report-095.pdf).
neighbors.influence_justification: Principal is a prominent local physician (50+ years experience) and the entity controls significant land with active industrial/mining leases.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Dr. Gary Harbin directly. Acknowledge his dual interests in sustainable agriculture (Land Institute donation) and industrial land utilization (sand mining). Position the project as compatible with both revenue goals and land preservation.

neighbors.profile_summary: Entity managed by Dr. Gary Harbin; combines agricultural holdings with active sand/gravel mining leases.

citations.claim: Managed by Dr. Gary Harbin, a prominent local orthopedic surgeon
citations.title: Gary L. Harbin, M.D. - Salina Ortho

citations.title: Saline County Planning & Zoning Commission Agenda Aug 2023

citations.title: The Land Institute Land Report 95

neighbors.name: Tillberg Arnold E Tr
neighbors.claims: The Tillberg Arnold E Trust appears to be a passive land-holding entity. The namesake, Arnold E. Tillberg, was active in the region as early as the 1960s (attending Kansas State University) and 1980s (Arnold E. Tillberg, Inc.), suggesting a long-standing family presence [Kansas State University Yearbook](https://archive.org/stream/royalpurple1960unse/royalpurple1960unse_djvu.txt). A related entity, 'Tillberg Land, LLC,' was forfeited by the Kansas Secretary of State in 2020 and 2022, indicating potential inactivity or consolidation of business structures [Kansas Secretary of State](https://sos.ks.gov/publications/Register/Volume-41/PDF/Vol-41-No-34-August-25-2022-July-2022-Forfeitures.pdf). The Trust was identified as a property owner within the notification radius of the Mountain Peak Energy Storage (battery) project in 2023-2025, placing it geographically near recent renewable development controversies [Saline County Planning](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/media/planning-zoning/Conditional%20Use%20Permit%20Application/Mountain%20Peak/Appendix%20L%20through%20R.pdf).
neighbors.influence_justification: No active political or business leadership found; related LLCs are forfeited.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach as a legacy landowner. Verify current trustee contact information, as corporate filings for related entities are not in good standing.

neighbors.profile_summary: Legacy family trust with history in the region; related corporate entities are inactive.

citations.claim: Arnold E. Tillberg was active in the region as early as the 1960s
citations.title: Royal Purple Yearbook 1960

citations.claim: Tillberg Land, LLC was forfeited by the Kansas Secretary of State
citations.title: Kansas Register Vol 41 No 34 Forfeitures

citations.claim: Identified as a property owner within the notification radius of the Mountain Peak Energy Storage project
citations.title: Mountain Peak Energy Storage Conditional Use Permit Application Appendix

neighbors.name: Bradshaw Business Properties Llc
neighbors.claims: Bradshaw Business Properties LLC is a land-holding entity associated with Rodney A. Bradshaw, a Salina resident [Saline County Planning](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/media/planning-zoning/Conditional%20Use%20Permit%20Application/Mountain%20Peak/Appendix%20L%20through%20R.pdf). The entity's corporate status was forfeited in Kansas as of July 2021, suggesting the LLC may be defunct or administratively neglected despite continuing to hold property title [Kansas Secretary of State](https://sos.ks.gov/publications/Register/Volume-40/PDF/Vol_40_No_34_August_26_2021_July_2021_Forfeitures.pdf). The LLC was listed as a notified neighbor for the Mountain Peak Energy Storage project in 2023-2025, indicating the property is located in an area recently subject to intense zoning debates regarding battery storage [Saline County Planning](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/media/planning-zoning/Conditional%20Use%20Permit%20Application/Mountain%20Peak/Appendix%20L%20through%20R.pdf).
neighbors.influence_justification: Entity is forfeited/inactive; limited to property ownership.

approach_recommendations.engage: Direct outreach to Rodney A. Bradshaw in Salina. Note that the LLC is currently forfeited, which may complicate lease signing; this could be a leverage point to offer legal/admin assistance as part of a land deal.

neighbors.profile_summary: Inactive/forfeited LLC holding land near contested battery storage site; controlled by Rodney Bradshaw.

citations.claim: Associated with Rodney A. Bradshaw, a Salina resident
citations.title: Mountain Peak Energy Storage Conditional Use Permit Application Appendix

citations.claim: Entity's corporate status was forfeited in Kansas as of July 2021
citations.title: Kansas Register Vol 40 No 34 Forfeitures
